sentences.sContent: There are more important matters we need to discuss.
sentences.sCn: 我们有更重要的事情需要讨论。

sentences.sContent: Does it matter what I think?
...Often the best ideas for big changes come from unexpected places — it’s just a matter of tuning in...
...I momentarily wondered if I couldn't just call an expert on the subject matter which I was tackling...
...It doesn't matter when or how much a person sleeps...
...The first is that no matter how many women may be getting college degrees...
...The pledge has been a matter of some debate in philanthropic and non-profit circles...
...it's a matter of paying now for the hardware to save later on the utilities...
...While graduates from top universities are still likely to get a good job, no matter what their major is...
...But it actually shouldn't matter to you nearly as much as you think...
...A search is now under way to confirm the suspected existence of particles of matter that move at a speed greater than light...
...Bishop describes the problem as simply a matter of priorities...
...with the museums and restaurants in Washington I’ll be happy here no matter what the temperature.Q：What does the woman mean...

phrases.pCn: 有机质；有机物；有机物质
就此而言；至于那个；说到那一点
无论发生什么事；无论出现什么情况
在这件事情上；对这个问题
只是时间问题；某事肯定发生只是时间问题而已
左右；大约只不过在…之内

trans.tranOther: a subject or situation that you have to think about or deal with
to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens
